definition: feeling brambles and thorns in one's back (idiom)/uneasy and nervous/to be on pins and needles
awn (of cereals)/arista (of grain)/tip (of a blade)/Miscanthus sinensis (type of grass)/variant of 邙, Mt Mang at Luoyang in Henan
(onom.) whoosh
thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
variant of 背[bei1]
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: The general now feels the quartermaster to be a thorn in his side.
sentences.chinese: 此刻，将军只觉得粮官让他感到芒刺在背。

sentences.english: These fears of foreshadowing make people as huangcizaibei, such as wheat LinLin sweat.
sentences.chinese: 这些恐惧的预示令麦子等人如芒刺在背，冷汗淋淋。

sentences.english: She feels prickles down her back.

definition: lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
lit. as if having a fish bone stuck in one's throat (idiom)/fig. very upset and needing to express one's displeasure
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
fish bone stuck in one's throat (idiom); fig. to feel obliged to speak out candidly/sth on one's mind
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
panic-stricken
to be restless
needle felting (craft)/piece of felt used as a pincushion
shiver all over though not cold/tremble with fear/shudder
facing imminent catastrophe/calamity looms/all hell will break loose
a thorn in one's flesh
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
fearful
lit. a bird startled by the mere twang of a bow (idiom)/fig. sb who frightens easily, due to past experiences
to tremble with fear (idiom)/scared witless
